segments.en: Dear Miss Cooper, I'm writing to confirm the final quotation for the full page back cover color advertisement you requested for the spring issue of Viola magazine.
segments.cn: 亲爱的Cooper小姐，我写信确认您请求的《Viola》杂志春季刊的全页封底彩色广告的最终报价。

segments.en: That's great.
The final costing, including advert design and production, comes to $45,600 RMB.
segments.cn: 最终费用，包括广告设计和制作，总计45,600元人民币。

segments.en: We want payment 10 working days before publication, or we will cancel the ad.
segments.cn: 我们希望在出版前10个工作日内收到付款，否则我们将取消广告。

segments.en: Thanks for... Whoa, okay, back up a second, Tracy.
segments.cn: 谢谢... 哇，好的，等一下，Tracy。

segments.en: That's too direct.
Can I suggest you say, Please note that the final payment is due two working weeks before publication?
segments.cn: 我可以建议你说，请注意，最终付款在出版前两周到期吗？

segments.en: You don't want to offend her.
Oops.
Okay, you're right.
Then I can just end with, All the best, Tracy.
segments.cn: 那我可以结束说，祝一切顺利，Tracy。

segments.en: Maybe I'd play it safe and finish with, Yours sincerely.
segments.cn: 也许我会稳妥一些，最后说，您诚挚的。

segments.en: That's more professional.
Oh, Melanie, you're a lifesaver.
Thank you.
So talking about ending formal emails or emails that you're writing to clients, colleagues, we can say sincerely in your name.
segments.cn: 所以谈到结束正式邮件或写给客户、同事的邮件时，我们可以说“诚挚的”加上你的名字。

segments.en: Sincerely, Marco.
You can say all the best, best regards.
segments.cn: 你可以说“祝一切顺利”、“最好的问候”。

segments.en: Now I've noticed that some people who aren't native English speakers, sometimes they will close a letter, maybe even a formal letter, saying Yours truly, Marco, for example.
segments.cn: 现在我注意到一些非英语母语的人，有时他们会在信的结尾，甚至是正式信中说“您诚挚的”，例如Marco。

segments.en: Is that really appropriate for a business setting or a client?
segments.cn: 这在商业环境或客户中真的合适吗？

segments.en: I would not use Yours truly.
Maybe if you're trying to build a relationship with your client and you're very honest, but it seems to me to be very personal.
segments.cn: 也许如果你想与客户建立关系并且非常诚实，但在我看来这显得非常个人化。

segments.en: Very romantic.
Yes, Yours truly.
So I would say in that case, Use sincerely or Kind regards or regards, which are a little bit more professional and less emotional.
segments.cn: 所以我会说在这种情况下，使用“诚挚的”或“亲切的问候”或“问候”，这些更专业且不那么情感化。

segments.en: If you want to have a romantic letter, you can say, you know, All my love or love or Yours truly or Yours faithfully.
segments.cn: 如果你想写一封浪漫的信，你可以说，您知道的，“我所有的爱”或“爱”或“您诚挚的”或“您忠实的”。

segments.en: This is a very important topic, I think, because many times in school we do learn how to write letters, but usually they are more personal letters.
segments.cn: 我认为这是一个非常重要的话题，因为很多时候在学校我们确实学习如何写信，但通常它们是更个人的信件。

segments.en: And so we memorize that usually at the end of the email or the end of the letter, you say Yours Marco or Yours truly Marco.
segments.cn: 所以我们通常记住在邮件或信的结尾，你说“您忠实的Marco”或“您诚挚的Marco”。

segments.en: And although it is correct, it's not really appropriate for a professional setting.
segments.cn: 尽管这是正确的，但在专业环境中并不真正合适。

segments.en: That's right.

So just as a reminder, if you're signing off your email or your letter and you're at an office, you're in your company, you want to say best or best regards or some of the things that we talked about here today.
segments.cn: 所以作为提醒，如果你在办公室或公司签署你的邮件或信件，你想说“最好的”或“最好的问候”或我们今天讨论的一些内容。

segments.en: Very good.
All right.
So if you have any questions or any other doubts, you can always find us at and we'll see you guys there.
segments.cn: 所以如果你有任何问题或其他疑虑，你可以随时找到我们，我们会在那里见到你。

segments.en: Bye.
Bye.
